elements.text: PAUL McGANN Time traveller.
JULIE COX 19th Century author, turned time-space traveller.
NIA BRUSK / HOVER-SENTRIES:
Rebellious firebrand, believed to have assassinated President
Karnex. / Two prototype security robots which speak with one digital mind.
JOHN VALLAN / MR STENNEN: Stronghaven’s nervous new President. / President Harmon’s right-hand man, faithful to the end.
MEERA DARONE / SHERLA RANDALL: President Vallan’s tough Aide and lover. / Nia Brusk’s fellow jail escapee.
PRESIDENT KARNEX / CAPTAIN MADDOX: Evil madman, wants to be reborn as The Bone Lord. / I1l-fated relatively new recruit to Stronghaven security.
PRESIDENT HARMON / PRIVATE BADEN: Disfigured former Garrak leader and alleged cultist. / Sensitive soldier.
COMMANDER RAYNAR / TOX MERLAN: Head Of Security for Stronghaven’s Senate Building. / One of President Harmon’s few surviving men.
OTHER PARTS PLAYED BY MEMBERS OF THE CAST.
BARNABY EDWARDS
ALAN BARNES
DAVID RICHARDSON
NICHOLAS BRIGGS & JASON HAIGH-ELLERY.
BIG FINISH PRODUCTIONS LTD © 2011
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 1
EPISODE ONE
SCENE 1: INT. TARDIS (MARY’S ROOM)
(FX: JOURNAL PAPER-SCRIBBLING, CONTINUOUS) My beliefs have been in flux, these past few weeks. But one thing I know: everybody has a soulmate. Someone whom they were always intended to meet.

My own soulmate was always going to be of a certain breed. He would be... wild. And yet intellectual. He would blend urbane eloquence with boundless enthusiasm. In short, he would be an unearthly soul.
I have already met this man. His name is... of course... (UNCONVINCING) Percy Shelley. My beloved.
FX: KNOCK ON THE DOOR
(OFF) Mary? Are you decent?
Oh. Not entirely! I’1l be out in a few moments.
Time and space wait for no-one.
FX: JOURNAL PAPER-SCRIBBLING, CONTINUOUS

(BACK TO JOURNAL VOICE) This journal entry must end here, as we are apparently about to materialise. I shall bring the book with me, however, as always. Oh my! I have THAT feeling again — a giddy delight in the pit of my stomach. What awaits us on the planet Draxine? (SIGNING) Mary Shelley.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 2
SCENE 2: CUT
SCENE 3: INT. SENATE BUILDING (GREAT HALL)
FX: THRUM OF ASSEMBLED PRESS IN ECHOEY HALL

(MIC DISTORTION) As we all know, President Karnex was a great man and a truly great president of our beloved city of Stronghaven. The fact that he has been so cruelly and violently taken from us only bears testament to his courage and honesty — qualities sadly lacking in the late President Harmon of Garrack, who brought about the destruction of his entire city and its population.

My people, this is the dawn of a new era. We must not be fearful; but neither must we be too willing to place trust in outsiders who seek to destroy our way of life. With the city of Garrack gone, we in Stronghaven must look to ourselves for the strength we require. And although it is true that we once thought we needed Garrak — that we once viewed it as our twin city — we now know in our hearts that all we really need to survive is ourselves... Our city... Stronghaven!
FX: POLITE CROWD APPLAUSE
Thank you.
FX: DURING THE APPLAUSE, WE CROSS FADE TO THE NEXT SCENE
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 3
SCENE 4: EXT. STRONGHAVEN SENATE BUILDING (ENTRANCE)
(FX: WIND WHISTLES, TREES CREAK. CAPTAIN MADDOX IS WATCHING THE SPEECH ON HIS WRIST-WATCH VIDEO MONITOR — THE APPLAUSE IS TINNY )
Vallan loves the sound of his voice, doesn’t he? (HE TURNS OFF THE WRIST WATCH) ‘Our city’, ‘our way of life’ — what he really means is ‘his city’, ‘his way [of life]-
Captain.
What is it, Baden?
Thought I saw something move, sir. But... but it’s gone now.
FX: MADDOX ACTIVATES HIS ELECTRONIC GUN SIGHT
I can’t see anything. (DEACTIVATES IT. AMUSED) Must have been one of President Harmon’s ghosts, eh?
(SPOOKED) Then the rumours are true? Garrak’s dead have risen up against us?
Pull yourself together, boy! Harmon was just a man, like Karnex — and that’s it. Stronghaven’s not going to be attacking by legions of the undead — at least not on my watch.
(A LAUGH OF RELIEF) Glad to hear it, sir. For a moment-
(FX: IN THE MIDDLE DISTANCE: A SUDDEN CLICK OF BONES — LIKE A SKELETON ASSEMBLING ITSELF. EERIE WIND BETWEEN TREES. )
(INSTANTLY THE MILITARY TRAINING KICKS IN) Quiet! (ACTIVATES SIGHT AGAIN) You’re right, private: definite movement. Looks like we've got ourselves a visitor.
(FX: IN THE MIDDLE DISTANCE, ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE STEREOFIELD, TWO MORE SKELETONS ASSEMBLE)
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 4
Two more to the right, sir. In the shadows to between the trees.
FX: DISTANT CLICK-CLACKING OF BONES APPROACHING
(IN MILITARY MODE) Switch sights to infra red.
(FX: TWIN DIGITAL NOISES TO DENOTE INFRA RED SWITCHES ON THEIR RIFLES )
What the hell?
(GRIM) Bones. Moving bones.
(THOROUGHLY SPOOKED) Skeletons! Garrak’s dead!
There are no such thing as ghosts, boy. Ready your weapon.
FX: TWO RAPID-FIRE WEAPONS COCKED
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 5
SCENE 5: INT. SENATE BUILDING (GREAT HALL)
FX: THRUM OF ASSEMBLED PRESS IN ECHOEY HALL
(MIC DISTORTION) I will now accept limited questions from the floor. Raise your hand and the microphone will hover to you.
(SIMULTANEOUS CLAMOUR) Over here! This way!
(MIC DISTORTION) Yes, you. No, behind the one in green. Thank you.
JOURNO # 1:
(MIC DISTORTION) President Vallan: do you plan to retain your predecessor’s recent policy on the exclusion of Garrak-born citizens from Stronghaven?

(MIC DISTORTION) Regrettably so. (FX: SURPRISED MURMUR FROM CROWD) President Karnex’s decision was not taken lightly, and I know it has had a real impact on our society. However, the moment that President Harmon of Garrak was revealed as a dangerous cult leader — and given what we now know about the explosion, there can be no doubt about this — once, as I Say, we knew their President was unstable, it became apparent that any Garrak-living, or even Garrak-born, citizen is a potential threat to Stronghaven security.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 6
SCENE 6: EXT. STRONGHAVEN SENATE BUILDING (ENTRANCE)
FX: CLICK-CLACKING OF BONES GETS CLOSER FROM NOW ON
Well what are they, then, if they’re not the risen dead?
The nearly dead. (YELLING) Stay where you are, all of you! If you do not identify yourselves immediately, we shall have no choice but to open fire.
Shall I summon the Hover-Sentries, sir?
No point. They’re miles away across the forest, searching for
the prisoners.
They’re not stopping!
Let’s see if this helps make up their minds.
(FX: RAPID-FIRE BULLETS. AN INHUMAN GROWL OF PAIN AS BONES FLY APART AND LAND ON GRASS.)
(YELLING) You were warned. Now back off!
(FX: TO THE LEFT, RIGHT AND AHEAD OF THEM, MORE SKELETONS BEGIN ASSEMBLING)
There’s more of them! They keep appearing! This is insane.
(CLOSE, INTENSE) Listen, soldier: we are Stronghaven’s first line of defence — so man up! You take the left, I’1ll take the right. Rapid, short bursts. Fire!
FX: TWO RAPID-FIRE BURSTS. BONES FLY APART. INHUMAN GROWLS.
Again.
FX: TWIN RAPID-FIRE BURSTS CONTINUE. BONES SHATTER, GROWLS
There’s too many!
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 7
Keep firing.
FX: ANOTHER TWIN BURST. BONES, GROWLS.
It’s no good. How do you kill the dead? (BACKING OFF) I've... I’ve got to get out of here.
FX: ANOTHER BURST, JUST FROM MADDOX THIS TIME. BONES, GROWLS
Private! Get back to your post at once!
(RUNNING AWAY) I’m sorry, Sir! So sorry.
Baden! Baden!!
FX: A SUDDEN CLOSE CLACK OF A LEAPING SKELETON & A HISS
You want some, skull face?
(FX: MADDOX FIRES. BONES, GROWLS. MORE SKELETONS APPEAR TO TAKE THE PLACE OF THEIR FALLEN COMRADE. CLOSER, CLOSER. ALL
AROUND MADDOX)
(IN BETWEEN BURSTS OF FIRE) Stay back! I’m warning you: stay back! I’11 kill the lot of you.
(FX: HE IS OVERWHELMED. CLICK-CLACKS AND SAVAGE INHUMAN GROWLS )
Arghhhhhh!
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 8
SCENE 7: INT. SENATE BUILDING (GREAT HALL)
CLAMOUR OF DISSENT FROM THE PRESS.
(MIC DISTORTION) Extreme measures can provoke extreme reactions.
JOURNO # 1:
(MIC DISTORTION) But would you agree the hardline measures of the Stronghaven government may have been the reason President Karnex was assassinated, in this very hall?
MURMURS OF AGREEMENT

(MIC DISTORTION) That is the risk that I, like President Karnex, must take. I firmly believe that in the long-term it will become clear to all that the Garrak Exclusion Bill has ensured Stronghaven’s safe future. And I would remind you that the very opinion polls that you members of the press so often quote at us, clearly indicate that the vast majority of Stronghaven citizens agree. Move the microphone to that one, please. Yes?
JOURNO # 2:
(MIC DISTORTION) Here at The Daily Bulletin, we exclusively understand that President Karnex’s assassin — Nia Brusk — has escaped. Is that correct?
SHOCK — THIS IS NEWS TO SOME

(MIC DISTORTION) Er... As you know, I am determined to maintain the openness and honesty which marked President Karnex’s term in office. Therefore... I can only confirm this news. (FX: MORE CROWD ALARM, OUTRAGE) But I assure you, our new Hover-Sentries are scanning the whole 10-mile stretch between here and the Garrak ruins. Rest assured that Brusk and her fellow escapee Sherla Randall will be back in custody very soon.
JOURNO # 2: (MIC DISTORTION) But how exactly did Brusk manage to escape?
(MIC DISTORTION) Thank you, members of the press. Regrettably we need to cut this Q&A short. I do apologize.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 9
DISGRUNTLED, DISAPPOINTED
(MIC DISTORTION) I’m sorry, but we will schedule another one soon. Mr President?
(MIC DISTORTION) Apologies, and thank you all.
(FX: DISGRUNTLED NOISE, WEAK APPLAUSE. TWO FOOTSTEPS WALK OFFSTAGE — WE GO WITH THEM. JOURNO CROWD NOISE FADES)
(SOTTO) Meera, why did you cut it short? I was doing all right out there. I could hardly deny that Brusk was loose.
(SOTTO) It’s not that. We have a security breach.
(SOTTO) Don’t tell me more Garrak prisoners have broken out?
(SOTTO) No, and we’re still hunting Brusk and Randall through the forest. This is something new. Very new. (LOUDER) Guards! Escort us to the President’s office. Commander Raynar?
Yes, Lady Meera.
Evacuate the press quickly, making sure none of them so much
as glimpse the Senate’s North Wing.
Understood.
FX: HE HEADS OFF
Why can’t the press see the North Wing?
Because we’re being invaded.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 10
SCENE 8: EXT. FOREST (PATH)
FX: TARDIS DOOR SHUTS. WIND BLOWS TREES
I thought you said we’d arrive in time for luncheon? Looks like we’ve missed it by several hours.
The planet’s in perpetual twilight. It’s either eerie or beautiful, depending on your point of view.
I choose the latter.
A Romantic through and through! The stars are astonishing, aren’t they? Shall we stroll beneath them, Mary? Would you take my arm?
(SLIGHTLY FLUSTERED) I... er, no, I’m quite content as I am. Thank you.

(CHEERY, OBLIVIOUS) As you wish. Now, if my calculations and co-ordinates serve me well, the people we’1l encounter here are tenth generation settlers from Earth... all very peaceful and happy. And this is the continent of Zelonia, the most serene country on the planet.

‘Serene’, you say? Hmmm. I remember you using that word about the planet Mayhem. You were at pains to predict how amusingly ironic I would find the name Mayhem once I had visited the place. Sadly, there was a noticeable absence of irony.

Which is, in itself, kind of ironic, don’t you think? I still have one strand of duckwolf-weed stuck between my toes — can’t get it out for love nor money. But trust me, Zelonia’s a totally different kettle of fish. See that glass dome in the far distance, at the base of the cliffs? That’s the city of Stronghaven. As the name suggests, it’s a place of stability, tranquility and safety. Let’s head for that. I’m sure they’1l stump up a five-star luncheon!
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 11
SCENE 9: INT. SENATE BUILDING (PRESIDENTIAL OFFICE)
FX: ELECTRONIC DOOR LOCK ACTIVATES
Meera, there are guards outside. There’s surely no need to lock the office door as well?
Better safe than sorry.
Look: what is going on?
Listen to this. Private Baden’s emergency call to Commander Raynar, 15 minutes ago.
(FX: ACTIVATES HER WRIST COMMUNICATOR. RECORDING BEGINS WITH A BEEP. )
(DISTORT, RUNNING) This is Private Baden. Red alert — the Senate Building is under attack. Captain Maddox is down!
(DISTORT) Raynar here. Under attack? Be more specific, private.
Who is attacking us?
(DISTORT) The dead, Sir. The dead are coming!
(DISTORT) I didn’t catch that, Baden. Repeat.
(DISTORT) The walking dead, Sir. Skeletons. Bare bones, that’s all they are.
(DISTORT) Have you lost your senses, Private?
FX: CLICK-CLACKING AND GROWLS ON THE RECORDING
(DISTORT) They’re here! They’re inside the Senate!
FX: BADEN FIRES HIS GUN. BONES, GROWLS
Get away from me! No! Nooo! Aaaarrghhhhh!
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 12
(DISTORT) Baden? Come in! Baden!
(FX: CLICK-CLACKS, CLOSE UP SKELETON GROWL DISTORTING, COMMUNICATOR DIES. RECORDING ENDS WITH A ‘BEEP’ )
Now perhaps you’1ll understand my precautions.
It’s unbelievable. (INTO COMMUNICATOR) Come in, Commander Raynar. Report, please.
(DISTORT) Raynar here, Mr President. The press have been evacuated without incident and we now have the situation in hand. All intruders have been... disabled.
“Disabled”?
(DISTORT) I’m reluctant to say “killed”, Sir. Given, you know, the nature of the enemy.
But you have stopped them, haven’t you, Commander?
(DISTORT) Might I suggest you both come over and see for yourselves? We’re in the North Wing, Corridor C, near the Great Hall.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 13
SCENE 10: EXT. FOREST (PATH)
(FX: TWO SETS OF FOOTSTEPS STROLL ALONG PATH, WIND BLOWS TREES. FOOTSTEPS STOP. )
Don’t tell me: you’re lost.
I didn’t bargain on the forest roof becoming quite this dense. I’ll be okay just as soon as I find the moon again. Ah, look — a clearing ahead of us. Come on.
FX: HE STRIDES OFF; MARY CATCHES UP WITH HIM
(LOW) Wait! (THEY STOP) Look: on the far side. There’s someone
sleeping on the ground.
(LOW) Then we must be careful not to wake them. Perhaps if we—
FX: A LOUD CRACK OF TWIGS
(COLD, LOW) Both of you, put your hands in the air and slowly - very slowly — turn around to face me.
FX: TWO SETS OF FEET TURN AROUND
Hello. My! You’re very tall, aren’t you? I wonder if you’d
mind lowering the crossbow. You have nothing to fear from us.
The same can’t be said for me. One false move and it’1l be your last. (LOUD) Sherla, wake up. Company.
(SOTTO) It’s Mayhem all over again.
(LOUDER) Sherla!
FX: BACKGROUND SHUFFLING OF SHERLA WAKING UP ON GROUND
(OFF) Nia? What’s going on?
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 14
Visitors.
(OFF) What kind?

Unwelcome. It’s okay, I’1l deal with them. You pack and get ready to move. (TO MARY & THE DOCTOR) Now then, you two. I have a very important question for you. Think carefully before you answer, because there’s a lot riding on what you say. Why shouldn’t I slaughter you like a couple of quayla-beast?
Funnily enough, that’s not as question I get asked that frequently.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 15
SCENE 11: INT. SENATE BUILDING (CORRIDOR)
FX: VALLON IS EXAMINING A DOWNED SKELETON
“Bare bones”, just as Baden said. A trail of bones...
That’s why I wanted you to see it for yourself, Lord President. That and what’s about to happen.
What’s about to [happen]-
(FX: LOW RASP OF BONES SHUFFLE ACROSS THE FLOOR IN GRADUAL BURSTS, CONTINUOUS )
Oh. I see.
They move? The bones move?!
Yes, Sir. They don’t give up. Like the skeletons before them, they keep heading in the same direction. Single file — like ants.
How long is this trail, Commander?
It leads all the way in from the North entrance, Lady Meera. As far as we can tell, that’s where the skeletons made their first appearance — out of the forest.
Have you been using flamer-throwers on them?
No, Sir. They were scorched like that already. We merely blew them apart.
Immune to bullets, immune to fire. How do you stop a thing like that?
Like this. (CRRRR-UNCH! A BOOT REDUCES BONES TO DUST) I’m sorry Lady Meera, it’s not pretty but it works. They only stop moving when practically reduced to dust.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 16
(FX: BONES SLIDE ACROSS THE FLOOR IN SLOW BURSTS, AND CONTINUE TO DO SO)
How did they get so close to the Senate without being detected? Where were the Hover-Sentries?
Both off searching for the prisoners, Sir.
But if they were scanning the forests, why didn’t they detect an impending attack on the Senate?
I don’t know, ma’am. Would you like me to bring the Sentries in for a diagnostic?
No: we have to find Nia Brusk before we drown in a tidal wave of bad press.
All this hammers home just how unprepared we are. We need to toughen up, Commander, so rally more recruits. And destroy the rest of these bones.
Yes, Lord President. Guards! Get stomping!
(FX: THE REPEATED STOMPING OF BOOTS ON BONE, REDUCING THEM TO DUST...)
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 17
SCENE 12: EXT. FOREST (TREES)
FX: SHERLA IS PACKING UP THEIR THINGS IN THE MIDDLE DISTANCE
For the last time: where you are from?
We’ve told you: we’re travellers.
Strangers in a strange land. By the way, I didn’t think weapons had been needed in Zelonia for centuries. (THE THOUGHT OCCURS TO HIM) I say, you two aren’t criminals, are you?
Only in Stronghaven’s eyes. We met in prison.
Prison? What had you done?
(APPROACHING) Don’t listen to her, Nia. She knows full well who you are. Come on, best get moving before the Hover- Sentries pick up our trail.
Hover-Sentries, what are they?

Some sort of flying robot, I expect. People always come up with such dull names for these things. I’d go for something snappier. Flybots! Yes, that sounds good. ‘Dispatch the flybots to bring back their bodies.’
You really aren’t from round here, are you? I think you’d better come with us to Garrak.
And who, pray, is Garrak?
Garrak is Zelonia’s other major city. Rather a flashy affair, if memory serves: all fountains and Tiffany glass.
Not any more. Three weeks ago, Garrak and everyone in it, was destroyed by a bomb.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 18
The entire city? But that’s terrible. How did it happen?
President Harmon turned out to be an insane fanatic. He was determined to take everyone in Garrak to what he called “the grand utopia”.
Most people went along with it, whether voluntarily or not. Come on, let’s get moving.
(FX: THEY HEAD OFF, FEET SCRUNCHING LIGHTLY ON THE FOREST FLOOR)
So why weren’t you in Garrak when it happened?
Sherla and I were born there, but we’ve lived in Stronghaven for most of our lives. When Garrak went up, it was feared that Harmon’s death cult could infect Stronghaven too.
Everyone born in Garrak became ‘the enemy within’.
Especially me. Got myself branded an insurgent, just for publicly disagreeing with Stronghaven’s policies. I’ve been in and out of prison ever since.
So how many died in the Garrak explosion?
Thousands upon thousands. Many haven’t officially been named alive or dead.

Including my husband, Skylon. He commuted to Garrak every day to work for Harmon’s Ministry. He was there on the... he was there when it happened, I think. I can’t be sure because I’ve been locked up ever since and I’ve had no opportunity to search for him.
I’m so sorry.
If there’s any way we can help...
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 19
There is. You’ll make useful hostages, if we get cornered.
Not entirely what I had in mind. By the way, Nia, you said you’d been in and out of prison. If they keep letting you out, why did you bother escaping this time?
FX: DISTANT ROBOT NOISE
Ssssh! Keep down!
HOVER-SENTRIES: (DISTANT) Scanning Forest Sector 12C.
(HUSHED) Flybots?
(HUSHED) Spot on.
(HUSHED) No more talking. Move on and be ready to run at my command.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 20
SCENE 13: INT. STRONGHAVEN SENATE BUILDING (VALLAN’S CHAMBER)
FX: THE DOOR SLIDES OPEN & CLOSED AS MEERA ENTERS
Lord President, Commander Raynar informs me that all the bones have been disposed of. I think we should cancel your next Press Conference. Actually, perhaps the next two. It gives us more options.
(MUSING AS HE STARES OUT OF THE WINDOW) Do you think the people of Stronghaven have faith in me?
Of course they do, Sir.
There’s really no need to call me ‘Sir’ when it’s just you and me, Meera.
(SOTTO) The guard outside might hear... John.
I haven’t slept since the president died, you know. I used to sleep a lot, in the old days — when I thought I’d be Vice President for years.
This Senate Building is exactly where you deserve to be, John. You’1ll be a great leader.
Will I? It’s easy to lead during peacetime, Meera. But Garrak, Karnex and now this insane invasion...
You can do this. President Vallan will go down in history as the man who saved Stronghaven.
Do you think they’11 find out? About you, I mean.

I.. I don’t think so. No one knows but us. The only people who can alter the birthing records are the President and the Vice President — and you’re both of them. As far as Stronghaven’s concerned, I was born and raised here.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 21
Let’s hope it stays that way. If anyone ever discovered that I’d made an exception for you, I'd be torn from office and you’d be detained and expelled just like all the other Garrak- born.
No one knows. I moved here pre-school. Now sleep!
How am I supposed to do that?
You can at least try. No one should make decisions without rest. I’1l wake you in five hours.
Make it three. And wake me immediately if anything else
happens.
Very well. (SOTTO) Dream of me.
FX: ELECTRONIC DOOR SLIDES OPEN, MEERA EXITS, DOOR CLOSES
(TO COMPUTER) Dim lights.
Ambient luminescence decreasing.
(TO COMPUTER) Music. Something restful.
Define ‘restful’.
(TO COMPUTER) Never mind. I’1ll key it in manually.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 22
SCENE 14: EXT. FOREST (AIR)
FX: WHIRS AND HUMS OF HOVER-SENTRIES IN FLIGHT
HOVER-SENTRY #1: (SMOOTH ELECTRONIC VOICE) Status update: in flight over forest. Fuel cells at 65 per cent capacity.
(DISTORT) Sentry Two? Report.
HOVER-SENTRY #2: (SMOOTH ELECTRONIC VOICE, DIFFERENT PITCH) Scanning Sectors 9G
to 10A. No life-forms detected so far.
(DISTORT) Increase the speed of your search.
HOVER-SENTRY #1:
Increasing speed will reduce search efficacy.
(DISTORT) Just do it. And move to ground level.
HOVER-SENTRIES #1 & #2: Affirmative.
FX: SENTRY HUMS AND WHIRS INCREASE IN PITCH
(DISTORT) Oh, and Sentry One? Erase the expression “FYI” from your vocab-chip, would you?
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 23
SCENE 15: INT. SENATE BUILDING (VALLAN’S CHAMBER)
(FX: BEDSHEETS RUFFLED AS VALLAN TURNS IN BED, RESTLESS. LOW, ‘RESTFUL’ MUSIC PLAYS QUIETLY IN THE BACKGROUND )
RESTLESS GRUNTS. SHUDDERS
FX: RELAXING MUSIC CHANGES, SLOWS DOWN, BECOMES SINISTER
(TO SELF) Oh, great. Malfunction. (LOUD) Switch the music off.
KARNEX [PROJECTION] : (ICY, GHOSTLY) Vallan...
FX: FLURRY OF BEDSHEETS
Who’s there? Lights on. Lights ON!
Habitat control suspended.
What do you mean, ‘suspended’? Call the guards!
Security protocol suspended.
KARNEX [PROJECTION]:
MOCKING LAUGHTER
Who’s there? I warn you, I’m armed.
KARNEX [PROJECTION]: Lying isn’t a very presidential trait, Vallan.
FX: KARNEX PARALYSIS SOUND — PIERCING, DISTINCTIVE CHIME
(SUDDENLY WEAK) What’s happening...? (STRUGGLING AGAINST IT. VERY QUIETLY) Guards... guards...
KARNEX [PROJECTION] : You want to run to the door, but your limbs betray you. That must be most upsetting.
(WEAKLY) Who are you? Are you here to kill me?
KARNEX [PROJECTION] : Don’t you recognize my voice? I’m Harmon. Valek Harmon.
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 24
(WEAKLY) Harmon? That’s impossible. You died in your own explosion... died along with all the Garraks you betrayed.
KARNEX [PROJECTION]: The report of my death was... not.. an exaggeration. I did die. And yet here I am.
(SHIVERS, UNNERVED) That’s impossible.
KARNEX [PROJECTION]: No less impossible surely than living skeletons attacking Stronghaven.
Those skeletons came from you?!
KARNEX [PROJECTION]:
They are my warriors. You stopped them, Vallan. An unwise and pointless thing to do. You cannot stop death. Death is relentless. Death never gives up until it gets what it wants.
And what is that you want, Harmon?
KARNEX [PROJECTION] : Lower the city’s defences. Reduce security to a mere token gesture.
And if I don’t?
KARNEX [PROJECTION]: I will return. And next time, our discourse will be less convivial.
(AS IF NOTHING HAS HAPPENED) Ambient luminescence increasing.
What? (LOUD) List all life-forms in this chamber!
Scanning for life-forms. (ELECTRONIC BURBLING) Humanoid life-
form, designate Vallan located. No other life-forms detected.
(SHAKEN) This is... insane...
DOCTOR WHO - ARMY OF DEATH by Jason Arnopp Page 25
SCENE 16: EXT. FOREST (CLEARING)
(FX: JOURNAL PAPER-SCRIBBLING, CONTINUOUS) My mind feels like a tangled ball of wool, which I very much feel the need to unwind.

MARY: The Doctor. What am I to make of him? I believe he has a hypnotic quality. An undeniable charisma which can blind one to the maelstrom which swirls around him. I was too busy falling for his unquestionably good heart — even believing him to be a soulmate — to notice his other travelling companion. The Reaper, constantly grinning by his side.
MARY: But my mind is now made up. I shall instruct the Doctor to take me to the place, where, for better or worse, I belong. The place where I am merely... (SIGNING) Mary Shelley.
CRASH IN CLOSING THEME: END
